byline.contributor: Safak Timur contributed reporting from Istanbul and Ankara, Turkey.

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who for years pursued policy of not antagonizing country's neighbors, now finds himself cornered by conflicts on many fronts, including deep divisions in his own society that he has helped create; Kurdish and Islamic State militants have struck Turkey 14 times in past year and fear of such violence has cut deeply into country's lucrative travel industry.
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan long professed a foreign policy of “zero problems with neighbors” but now seems mired in disputes with just about everybody.

headline.main: Turkish Leader Erdogan Making New Enemies and Frustrating Old Friends
headline.print_headline: Turkish Leader Makes New Foes and Vexes Allies

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan long professed a foreign policy of “zero problems with neighbors” but now seems mired in disputes with just about everybody....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
